overclocks.name: Improved Thermal Efficiency
overclocks.description: Get all you can from your fuel and lose pressure slower from the main chamber.

overclocks.name: Crystal Nucleation

buffs: Affected by cooling and damage mods

overclocks.description: A new cryoctane fuel blend creates razor-sharp formations of ice crystals on impact with terrain, which damage and slow enemies attempting to walk through them. These ice crystals melt over time, but can be maintained by cooling them. This modification results in a smaller overall fuel tank capacity to make room for the new fuel injector.

overclocks.name: Flow Rate Expansion
overclocks.description: A low-volume, high-pressure chamber paired with a high-power pump increases the flow rate and repressurization speed, but lower the max duration of sustained flow.

overclocks.name: Ice Spear
overclocks.description: Pressing the reload button dumps all the fluid in the chamber directly into the turbine, flash-freezing it and launching an ice projectile. Side effects include an increased recharge delay and, of course, the large amount of fuel used.

overclocks.name: Tuned Cooler
overclocks.description: Freeze things faster at the cost of a slower pump and turbine.

overclocks.name: Ice Storm
overclocks.description: A change in the fuel mixture (along with some heavy cooler unit tweaks) means a lot more damage -- especially to frozen targets. However, freezing takes longer, and the capacity of the pressure chamber is reduced.

overclocks.name: Snowball
overclocks.description: Pressing the reload button shoots all the cryofuel in the chamber at once as an AoE cryo-projectile. Besides the very large amount of fuel consumed, the operation overloads the whole system, resulting in a much longer delay before regaining pressure, and the modifications restrict the total amount of fuel you can carry.
